channel.title: 3News
channel.description: Latest Ghana news, breaking news, politics, business, sports, entertainment from 3News

item.title: Ghana to receive largest bulk carrier in West Africa’s history at Takoradi Port on Jan 27
item.description: Ghana is set to make maritime history later this month with the arrival of the largest bulk carrier ever to berth in West African waters. The MV CBS Years, a colossal vessel with a deadweight tonnage (DWT) of 300,000, will be officially welcomed at the Port of Takoradi on Tuesday, January 27, 2026. The landmark [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Agenda 111: Auditor-General orders 35 contractors to refund US$7.9m for failure to execute projects
item.description: The Ghana Audit Service has issued a surcharge against 35 contractors to pay US$7.9 million –approximately GH¢94.6 million — to the state. The amount was paid to them as mobilisation fees to execute Agenda 111 hospital projects on 19 sites. Out of the $11.16 million paid to the contractors, they together executed work valued at [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Arrogance of power – Ntim Fordjour fires back at Felix Kwakye Ofosu’s “overzealous” claim
item.description: John Ntim Fordjour has hit back at Felix Kwakye Ofosu, accusing him of displaying “arrogance of power.” The retort follows criticism from Minister Felix Kwakye Ofosu, who labeled Fordjour as “overzealous” and prone to getting “carried away” in his advocacy work. #3NewsGH #TV3GH Don’t forget to subscribe for more Updates: https://www.youtube.com/c/TV3Ghana #TV3Ghana Visit the News [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Transport Minister to meet GPRTU over ‘artificial vehicle scarcity’ in Accra
item.description: The Transport Minister, Joseph Bukari Nikpe is set to meet with the Ghana Private Roads and Transport Union (GPRTU) and commercial transport operators over the practice of renting vehicles and the creation of artificial scarcity in the transport sector. This was disclosed by the Minister for Government Communications, Felix Kwakye Ofosu at the Government Accountability [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Raphael Ghartey)

item.title: VALCO is one of Ghana’s most prized assets; don’t sell it – ICU
item.description: The Industrial and Commercial Workers’ Union (ICU), Ghana, has strongly opposed any attempt to sell the Volta Aluminium Company Limited (VALCO), describing such a move as a threat to Ghana’s long-term interest. In a press statement dated January 14, 2026, and signed by its General Secretary, Mr. Morgan Ayawine, the Union said VALCO remains one [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Daniel Opoku)

item.title: Health Ministry issues fresh meningitis alert as dry season raises outbreak risk
item.description: Ministry of Health and Ghana Health Service have issued a renewed meningitis alert, urging vigilance in the meningitis belt as the dry season heightens outbreak risks.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: GHC10M bail! Akonta Mining’s Owusu Bempah & Wontumi face illegal mining charges
item.description: The Accra High Court has granted Kwadwo Owusu Bempah, the General Manager of Akonta Mining a bail of GHC10m with three sureties, one to be justified. Owusu Bempah, together with NPP Ashanti Regional Chairman Bernard Antwi Boasiako aka Wontumi are among five accused persons charged with multiple illegal mining offences including felling of trees in [&hellip;]

item.description: The Accra High Court has granted Kwadwo Owusu Bempah, the Operations Manager of Akonta Mining a bail of GHC10m with three sureties, one to be justified. Owusu Bempah, together with NPP Ashanti Regional Chairman Bernard Antwi Boasiako aka Wontumi are among five accused persons charged with multiple illegal mining offences including felling of trees in [&hellip;]

item.title: US won’t block extradition of Ofori-Atta, Sedina Tamakloe — Ablakwa reveals
item.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Samuel Okudzeto Ablakwa says the US has assured Ghana it will not obstruct the extradition of Ken Ofori-Atta and Sedina Tamakloe Attionu amid ongoing legal processes.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Evans Effah)

item.title: JUSAG planned strike ‘regrettable’ but grievances will be addressed – Kwakye Ofosu
item.description: Minister for Government Communications, Felix Kwakye Ofosu has said government will address grievances of the Judicial Service Staff Association (JUSAG), describing their planned strike as “regrettable.” Speaking at the Government Accountability Series on Wednesday, January 14, 2026, Kwakye Ofosu noted “the JUSAG strike action is regrettable, it is not a desirable situation but I am [&hellip;]

item.title: Support and pass anti-LGBTQI+ bill – Foh-Amoaning to Pres. Mahama
item.description: Moses Foh-Amoaning, a private legal practitioner, has cautioned President John Mahama against being swayed by foreign influence and financial incentives, urging him instead to sign the controversial anti-LGBTQI+ bill. According to Foh-Amoaning, President Mahama invoked God’s name during his election campaign, and the most fitting way to show gratitude is by enacting the bill. “The [&hellip;]

item.title: Director General of NaCCA must resign – Ntim Fordjour on gender definition in teachers’ manual
item.description: Member of Parliament for Assin South, Rev. Ntim Fordjour has called for the immediate resignation of the Director General of the National Council for Curriculum and Assessment (NaCCA), Professor Samuel Ofori Obuobisah Bekoe over the controversial definition of gender in a teacher’s manual being used by secondary schools. He said Prof. Bekoe must be dismissed [&hellip;]

item.title: I have no time for ignorant people – Nyaho-Tamakloe responds to NPP’s Haruna Mohammed’s ‘no founding member’ claim
item.description: A founder member of the New Patriotic Party (NPP), Dr. Nyaho Nyaho-Tamakloe has criticised the Deputy General Secretary of the NPP, Haruna Mohammed over his claim that Dr. Nyaho Nyaho-Tamakloe is never regarded as a founding member of the party. item.title: University of Ghana questions GTEC’s approved fees, cites deviations from stakeholder agreements
item.description: University of Ghana has challenged GTEC’s approved fees for the 2025/2026 academic year, citing deviations from stakeholder agreements reached at a January 8 consultative meeting.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Evans Effah)

item.title: Passengers demand urgent action over sanitation crisis at Sofoline Lorry Terminal
item.description: Passengers and traders have raised concerns over poor sanitation at the Sofoline Lorry Terminal in Kumasi, calling on authorities to act swiftly to address mounting health risks.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Benjamin Aidoo)

item.title: Customs seize 25 million suspected illicit tablets hidden in ceiling fan containers at Takoradi Port
item.description: Ghana Customs officials have intercepted about 25 million suspected illicit tablets concealed in ceiling fan containers at Takoradi Port following an intelligence-led, multi-agency operation.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Komla Klutse)

item.title: Father arrested in Eastern Region for allegedly attempting to sell three-year-old son
item.description: Police in the Eastern Region have arrested a man for allegedly attempting to sell his three-year-old son for GH¢1 million. The child is now in protective custody as investigations continue.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: One dead as GNFS responds swiftly to road crash at Anyaa Market in Accra
item.description: One person has died following a motorcycle and truck collision at Anyaa Market in Accra after GNFS responded swiftly to the incident on Tuesday morning.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: “He is a fantastic guy who wants to help us” Bernardo Silva hails Semenyo’s impact
item.description: Bernardo Silva has been quick to applaud Manchester City’s new arrival, Antoine Semenyo, hailing both his quality and character after an electric start in sky blue. Speaking after City’s latest cup success, Silva highlighted how seamlessly the Ghanaian forward has fitted into Pep Guardiola’s squad, praising his attitude and willingness to contribute. item.title: I’m enjoying every moment” — Semenyo relishing perfect start at Manchester City
item.description: Antoine Semenyo has opened up on life at Manchester City following his move from Bournemouth, expressing delight at how quickly he has adapted and the confidence he is gaining in his new surroundings. The Ghanaian forward is already enjoying a near-perfect beginning to his City career, having found the net in back-to-back appearances across competitions. [&hellip;]

item.title: Semenyo shines again as Manchester City edge closer to Carabao Cup final
item.description: Antoine Semenyo’s electrifying start to his Manchester City career continued on Tuesday night as the Ghanaian forward once again delivered on the big stage, firing Pep Guardiola’s side closer to a place in the Carabao Cup final. item.title: Gambia Reparations Commission commences payments to victims of human rights violations
item.description: The Gambia Reparations Commission has announced that it has commenced the payment of reparations to victims of human rights violations committed between July 1994 and January 2017. A press release issued by the Commission said this marks a significant milestone in its mandate to facilitate justice, restore dignity, and support the recovery of victims who [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Health Minister directs managers of teaching hospitals to operate 24-hour OPD and lab services
item.description: The Minister for Health Kwabena Mintah Akandoh has directed all public teaching hospitals to urgently begin operating their Out-Patient Departments, laboratories, and diagnostic centres on a 24-hour basis, in line with the President’s 24-hour health service policy. He made this call during an ongoing sector-wide management retreat, which brings together leadership across the health sector [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Sarah Apenkroh)

item.title: Man United confrim Michael Carrick as caretaker head coach
item.description: Manchester United have appointed Michael Carrick as head coach until the end of the season. Carrick emerged as the frontrunner for the role after the club held discussions with the former midfielder and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer following the departure of Ruben Amorim on January 5. United have only the Premier League to focus on following [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Recent increase in ECG’s revenue generation strengthens case against its privatisation – TUC
item.description: The Trades Union Congress (TUC) says the recent surge in revenue at the Electricity Company of Ghana demonstrates that privatization is not the solution to the challenges facing the power distributor. According to the unions, a six-month turnaround programme implemented between July and December 2025 has transformed ECG’s financial position. In a statement read by [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Noble Crosby Annan)

item.title: Pictures: Ghanaian Engineering Reconstruction team and JDF make progress in rebuilding homes after Hurricane Melissa
item.description: Ghanaian Engineering Reconstruction team of the Ghana Armed Forces and the 1 Engineering Regiment of the Jamaican Defence Force (JDF) have recorded significant progress in rebuilding homes in Black River and Saint Elizabeth communities following the recent Hurricane that struck Jamaica. Following the disaster which occurred in October 2025, government deployed fifty-four (54) personnel from [&hellip;]

item.title: Santasi–Asokwa Road expansion project: KMA boss gives encroachers January 20 to quit
item.description: The Kumasi Metropolitan Assembly (KMA) has issued the final evacuation notice to clear the Santasi Roundabout–Asokwa Interchange corridor for the ongoing dual-carriage road construction project. Speaking on Ghanakoma morning show on Akoma 87.9 FM in Kumasi with Sir John, on Tuesday January 13,2026, the Kumasi Metropolitan Chief Executive, Richard Ofori-Agyeman Boadi, urged all occupants along [&hellip;]

item.title: ‘The young people need to know that SSNIT guarantees income in your retirement’ – SSNIT boss
item.description: The Director-General of the Social Security and National Insurance Trust (SSNIT), Kwesi Afreh Biney has underscored the post-retirement relevance of his outfit. He said although SSNIT may seem irrelevant when one is working, the Trust offers a lifeline during retirement. “The young people need to know that SSNIT guarantees you income in your retirement,” he [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Uganda orders temporary internet shutdown and SIM card restrictions two days to elections
item.description: Uganda’s Communications Commission has directed telecom operators to suspend public internet access, SIM card sales and outbound roaming from January 13, 2026, citing election security concerns.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Evans Effah)

item.title: The plan to expel Prof Frimpong-Boateng from NPP is misguided – Arthur Kennedy
item.description: My attention has been drawn to the purported plans by the NPP leadership to expel Prof. Frimpong Boateng following his interview with Bernard Avle yesterday. The plan to expel him is misguided. It will harm the damaged NPP further. This morning, I took the trouble to watch the whole interview. It was patriotic, visionary, nationalistic [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: ‘No need to change the winning team’ — TUC restates position against privatisation of ECG
item.description: The Trades Union Congress has vowed to resist any attempt by government to privatize ECG and NEDCo, describing the move as unjustified and potentially damaging. The unions say recent progress achieved through collaboration between workers, management and the Ministry of Energy proves that public utilities can deliver results when properly supported. According to a statement [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Noble Crosby Annan)

item.title: Kofi Adams inaugurates 13-member GADA board to strengthen Ghana’s fight against doping
item.description: Ghana has reaffirmed its commitment to clean and fair sport with the official inauguration of a 13-member Governing Board of the Ghana Anti-Doping Agency (GADA) by the Minister for Sports and Recreation, Kofi Adams. The event represents a major step forward in strengthening the country’s anti-doping framework and ensuring that Ghanaian athletes continue to compete [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Rabbi Adu Agyei)

item.title: “To hell with them” – Frimpong-Boateng slams NPP executives over expulsion move
item.description: Former Environment Minister Prof. Kwabena Frimpong-Boateng has blasted NPP leaders over moves to expel him, blaming corruption and arrogance for the party’s 2024 defeat and declaring, “to hell with them.”
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Evans Effah)

item.title: JUSAG to strike on January 19 over 8 months’ salary arrears
item.description: The Judicial Service Staff Association (JUSAG) has threatened to embark on a strike action on January 19 if salary arrears for its members are not paid. This is contained in a letter addressed to the Executive Secretary of the National Labour Commission and sighted by 3news.com. “The Judicial Service staff serving the third arm of [&hellip;]

item.title: NPP leadership’s bid to sack Frimpong-Boateng shows party is headed for destruction – Nyaho-Tamakloe
item.description: A New Patriotic Party (NPP) stalwart, Dr. Nyaho Nyaho-Tamakloe, has expressed his resolve not to allow some elements within the party to destroy it. item.title: NaCCA recalls SHS Physical Education and Health teachers’ manual over controversial gender identity definition
item.description: The National Council for Curriculum and Assessment (NaCCA) has instructed all teachers in possession of hard copies of the SHS Physical Education & Health teachers’ manual to return them immediately. The directive was prompted by concerns regarding a controversial definition of gender identity in the handbook, which is now being used in classrooms. Prof. Vincent [&hellip;]

item.description: Public Relations Officer of the Burniton Music Group Vida Adutwumwaa Boateng has disclosed that Stonebwoy’s Afcon Fan Zone performance scheduled for January 8, in Tangier, Morocco was postponed due to technical challenges on the part of the organizers. item.title: Frimpong-Boateng’s ‘fake’ party comment not a usual commentary from a senior member of NPP – Zaato
item.description: Dr. Joshua Zaato, Political Science Lecturer and Policy Analyst at the University of Ghana has criticised Prof. Frimpong-Boateng over his comment describing the New Patriotic Party (NPP) as a ‘fake’ party. This comes after the former Minister for Environment, Science, Technology and Innovation also alleged that the party “twisted people’s arms, bribing delegates and intimidated [&hellip;]

item.title: Surrogate Mother Gives Birth to Quadruplets in Ghana
item.description: A 30-year-old surrogate mother has given birth to quadruplets in Ghana, bringing hope and joy to a couple who had been struggling with infertility. The intended mother had lost her womb during a fibroid operation making it impossible for her to carry a pregnancy.
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Publishing Desk)

item.title: Bernard Ahiafor’s leadership has always been rooted in quiet delivery – Assembly Member
item.description: Japhet Festus Gbede, an Assembly Member and member of the Akatsi South NDC communication team, has strongly dismissed claims suggesting a lack of development in the constituency under the leadership of Member of Parliament Bernard Ahiafor. In a detailed statement shared on Facebook, on Monday, January 12,2026, Mr Gbede described such narratives as entirely inaccurate [&hellip;]
item.author: editorial@3news.com (Benjamin Aidoo)

item.title: Morocco vs Nigeria: Key statistics ahead of the semi-finals showdown
